atom3d.filters package¶

Submodules¶

atom3d.filters.filters module¶

Common filtering functions.

atom3d.filters.filters.compose(f, g)¶
atom3d.filters.filters.first_model_filter(df)¶

Remove anything beyond first model in structure.

atom3d.filters.filters.form_filter_against_list(against, column)¶

Filter against list for column of dataframe.

atom3d.filters.filters.identity_filter(df)¶
atom3d.filters.filters.single_chain_filter(df)¶

Remove anything that has more than one model/chain.

atom3d.filters.filters.standard_residue_filter(df)¶

Filter out non-standard residues.

atom3d.filters.pdb module¶

atom3d.filters.pdb.form_molecule_type_filter(allowed=None, excluded=None)¶

Filter by biomolecule type.

Valid entries are prot, prot-nuc, nuc, carb, other.

atom3d.filters.pdb.form_resolution_filter(threshold)¶

Filter by resolution of method used to determine.

atom3d.filters.pdb.form_size_filter(max_size=None, min_size=None)¶

Filter by number of residues.

atom3d.filters.pdb.form_source_filter(allowed=None, excluded=None)¶

Filter by experimental source.

Valid entries are diffraction, NMR, EM, other.

atom3d.filters.scop module¶

atom3d.filters.scop.form_scop_filter(level, allowed=None, excluded=None)¶

Filter by SCOP classification at a specified level.

Valid levels are type, class, fold, superfamily, family.

atom3d.filters.scop.form_scop_filter_against(sharded, level, conservative)¶

Remove structures with matching scop class to a chain in sharded.

We consider each chain in each structure separately, and remove the structure if any of them matches any chain in sharded.

This is done at the specified scop level, which can be one of type, class, fold, superfamily, or family.

Conservative indicates what we should do about pdbs that do not have any scop class associated with them. True means we throw out, False means we keep.

atom3d.filters.sequence module¶

atom3d.filters.sequence.form_seq_filter_against(sharded, cutoff)¶

Remove structures with too much sequence identity to a chain in sharded.

We consider each chain in each structure separately, and remove the structure if any of them matches any chain in sharded.
